oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Various excerpts
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Excerpts of live radio performances by Lew Childre, Bill Monroe and The Bluegrass Boys, Milton Estes, Clyde and Marie Dilleha, Pee Wee King and His Golden West Cowboys, George W. Wilkinson and His Fruit Jar Drinkers, and Cowboy Copas, recorded from a broadcast of WSM's Grand Ole Opry (Nashville, Tenn.) with emcees Grant Turner, George D. Hay, and Louis Buck.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Lew Childre; Bill Monroe and The Bluegrass Boys; Milton Estes; Clyde and Marie Dilleha
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: They Took The Stars Out Of Heaven (Lew Childre) -- I Saw Your Face In The Moon (Lew Childre) -- Lew Childre talks during a dance routine -- Footprints In The Snow (Bill Monroe and The Bluegrass Boys) -- George D. Hay talks -- Grant Turner talks (incomplete) -- George D. Hay introduces Milton Estes -- Milton Estes talks -- Long Lost John (Milton Estes) -- George D. Hay talks and introduces Clyde and Marie Dilleha -- No Children Allowed (Clyde and Marie Dilleha)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Childre, Lew, 1901-1961; Monroe, Bill, 1911-1996; Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Turner, Grant; Estes, Milton, 1914-1963; Dilleha, Laura Marie Stacey, 1921-2002; Cobb, David (Announcer); Keller, Ernie; Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; King, Pee Wee, 1914-2000; Golden West Cowboys (Musical group); Wilkinson, George; Fruit Jar Drinkers (Musical group)
